extendedInfo.description: Conflicts: American Revolutionary War is a turn based strategy game which takes place on the American East Coast.You are in command of the ragtag US armies during the American Revolutionary War 1775-1783. The object of the game is to fight off British forces and control enough cities to be able to claim independence. Events threatening the Colonies include raids by Iroquois warriors, uprisings by royalist units, and Hessians and British forces landing on your shores.Cities provide supply to units, while Plantations provide Gold which is needed for various purchases. New militia units can be formed from Minutemen locations still at your control. Any attacking unit needs to be located nearby a movable Ammo Depot, which can be created from Armories.FEATURES:+ Economy & Production: You decide how to use the meager resources at your disposal: Build roads, form more units, pacify restless elements, upgrade militia to cavalry or regular infantry, etc.+ Long-lasting: Thanks to in-built variation and the game's smart AI technology, each game provides a unique war gaming experience.+ Competitive: Measure your strategy game skills against others fighting for the Hall of Fame top spots.+ Supports casual play: Easy to pick up, leave off, continue later.+ Experienced units learn new skills, like improved attack or defense performance, extra move points, damage resistance, etc.+ Settings: Various settings to alter the look of the gaming experience: different icon sets for units (real - NATO - web 2.0), custom font and map size, etc.+ Tablet friendly strategy game: Automatically scales the map for any physical screen size/resolution from small smartphones to HD tablets, while settings allow you to fine tune hexagon and font sizes.In order to be a victorious general, you must learn to coordinate your attacks in two ways. First, as adjacent units give support to an attacking unit, keep your units in groups in order to gain local superiority. Secondly, it is rarely the best idea to use brute force when it is possible to encircle the enemy and cut off its supply lines instead.To get a sense of how Conflicts: American Revolutionary War works, try out Conflicts: Operation Barbarossa LITE -- http://goo.gl/vLuaP -- which uses the same mechanics as Conflicts: American Revolutionary War.Answer the call of duty and join Conflict series on Facebook or Google Plus!+ http://on.fb.me/wsC2QV (FB)+ http://bit.ly/GHHGU1 (G+)The list below includes the permissions requested and the reasons for their use.+ Internet: To fetch Hall of Fame data from a server.+ Network State: To determine whether or not you are connected to the Internet so the game doesn't crash while trying to connect.+ Control Vibrator: To vibrate the phone during the battles (visit settings to turn the feature OFF or alter its behavior).

reviews.title: Not getting bored with this offering
reviews.comment: Tough one...
reviews.author: Byron Brownfield

reviews.title: ARW gets better
reviews.comment: I\'m struggling with ARW.  A lot of map, very few units and a overly aggressive Brit AI.  I have not had a chance to be proactive.. just reacting.  Edit:  7/24/13 --- Changes to ARW has greatly improved it.  I\'ve raised it from 3 stars to 5.  It is still a challenge, but one that I feel is possible to defeat.  Kudos to Joni :-)
reviews.author: John Parrish

reviews.title: Best of Joni\'s Games
reviews.comment: I\'ve bought/played/won almost all of Joni\'s games and thought that he wasn\'t likely to release anything that came close to the intensity of Eastern Front.  In my opinion, this is his best though by some way.  The completely non-linear nature of the game play with no defined front lines and random events such as Indians, Royalist uprisings and the dreaded British fleet landing make for a truly engrossing game.    I\'ve only played v1.6 but can reassure people that it is beatable - although probably not the first few times you play it.  You need to seriously think about your tactics otherwise you\'ll just be overwhelmed.  If you\'re a serious strategy fan then you\'ll love this.
reviews.author: Dominic Robinson

reviews.title: This needs difficulty levels.
reviews.comment: There is no difficulty levels to change. It is very hard to win. I am experienced and have issues. It needs easier levels.
reviews.author: James Molinaro

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Lots of fun. Very difficult, but beat it after 324 turns. Highly recommend. Highly addictive game.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: All that needs to be said.

reviews.comment: best of series, very di fferent, all of which i beat cept east front ugh after several tries im on the way to stalingrad abit worse for wear, these games are great!

reviews.comment: It is a very fun game!

reviews.title: GS
reviews.comment: I love the game! Yes its hard but not impossable I finnished after a cupple hundred turns, but man it was fun an as close as your gona get to understanding the odds that our four fathers went thru to win. 5 stars all the way!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: gREAT!
reviews.author: Martin Labelle

reviews.title: American Revolutionary War
reviews.comment: I give this 4 stars. For the most part, the game works as expected.  The author needs to fix the following bugs: 1 Royalist Revolts in cities that are garrisoned does not seem realistic. 2 Speech cannot be applied to a unit collocated with a resource or other unit. 3 Roads should be buildable anywhere the user chooses, excluding lakes and oceans. 4 The game loses track of earlier road builds when building in multiple turns. 5 Richmond is misspelled.  The game is great.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best yet
reviews.comment: Best yet from this designer. Good simulation of guerilla war: Powerful British units can take territory but have trouble holding it if you keep your nerve and cut them off with your weaker units. Excellent variability of play as British, royalist, and Indian units pop up randomly in different places. Bravo.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Don\'t buy - lousy programming
reviews.comment: I have played and enjoyed every other game by this author.  This one is ridiculous.  Indians multiply like breeding rabbits.  There are not nearly enough resources to pay off the Indians and the Royalists and fight the limitless supply of British and sessions that keep landing.  This game Sucks.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great concept too many bugs
reviews.comment: If you have more then 2 resource screens available forget it, its lost and you can\'t use.  I gave up on the game when at the very end the fort at montreal was impossible to beat.  I sourounded it with 3 calvary and 4 infantry. Not a single victory after 10 turns.  If bugs can be corrected this has the potential to be one of the best android turn based war games available otherwise its garbage...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great game but
reviews.comment: Love the game but hate the fact that the British head directly for your gold plantations, so they know where they are going. When they take over an area you can\'t see where these lost plantations are as they are just red hexes. Surely you should still see this info within the red hexes as its weighted towards the British.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it!!
reviews.comment: Is there anyway the next upgrade can have game modes supply and normal??
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: American Revolution
reviews.comment: The best game on this subject I have seen. Enough uniqueness and variation from Joni\'s previous games to make it exciting!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very difficult.
reviews.comment: It\'s challenging almost to the point of making u wanna give up but like the real Americans of the time, if u stay with it, u can overcome the odds. Gameplay is the same addictive formula as previous releases from this author.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment: Love the new update fixed a lot of issues.
